name: Panang Chicken Curry
headline: Panang Chicken Curry

image.description: This image has been distributed to our partners.
This image has been distributed to our partners.
This image has been distributed to our partners.

recipeIngredient: 6 cups (1440 ml) full-fat coconut milk, with 3 tablespoons of the cream separated out
1/2 cup (95 g) brown onion, sliced thin
1 1/2 to 2 pounds (680 to 910 g) chicken breast, sliced thin
1 cup (240 g) canned bamboo shoots, sliced
1/2 cup (95 g) Thai sweet basil leaves, roughly chopped

recipeInstructions.text: In a heavy bottomed pot, heat the 3 tablespoons of the thick coconut cream to high for about 1 minute. When the cream starts to sizzle, stir in the curry paste into the cream like building a roux. Add the onion and half of the makrut lime leaf chiffonade. Stir-fry the paste until the paste starts to thicken, dry out, and become fragrant, about 1 minute. If the curry starts to sputter, add a small amount of coconut milk to keep the paste moving. Cook the paste until it has the consistency of peanut butter.

Stir in the remaining coconut milk into the curry paste. Increase the heat to high until you reach a full rolling boil. Allow the curry to boil until it reduces by about 25% or coats the back of a wooden spoon, 10 to 15 minutes.

Reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the chicken, tamarind paste, fish sauce and sugar. When the chicken is about halfway cooked, about 5 minutes, add the bell pepper and zucchini. Let simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Add the bamboo shoots and Thai basil leaves. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve immediately over jasmine rice and garnish with a few ribbons of the remaining makrut lime leaf.

review.reviewBody: Best curry ever! Yum!
Omg,this recipe is perfection in flavor and palate!it's heaven in your body!

So delicious!!! Follow the ready jet cook video he does with his wife and not this recipe (the recipe calls for 6 cups of coconut milk but Jet only uses one can in the video… I used two cans and I reduced it a lot). If you’re scared to try curry, definitely try this!! I can’t explain how flavorful and easy this was!!

The taste of this recipe is wonderful, but like other reviewers I couldn’t get my sauce to thicken. Perhaps my coconut milk was not fatty enough? The vegetables added water and didn’t help my cause. I used the full four oz can of curry paste so it was extra spicy. I’ll probably use the principles from this recipe for other curry pastes. This makes more than six servings, by the way.

Great recipe! I loved the flavors. I didn't have any lime leaves so I added a splash of lime juice with lime zest and it worked great. I may add Thai chilies or a little hot sauce to increase the spiciness.

The flavors of this recipe are incredible! My only problem is the consistency with coconut milk. I made sure to not shake the cans and use the cream, but I couldn’t keep the sauce from breaking and getting really oily. Any suggestions?
It was very hard for me to find the ingredients. The veggies added so much water to it that it became like soup.

1st time trying Thai recipes and love Jet on the Tournament of Champions. I substituted lime zest and green curry paste but somehow couldn’t get my sauce to thicken, I watched the video and had success until I added the rest of the canned coconut milk, any thoughts anyone?

2nd time trying this recipe and it’s a winner! The first time blew me away and now with the addition of the tamarind paste I couldn’t find before it is spot on. I did add some gochujang  for the heat..mmmmmm
We actually made this with the green curry paste - so yum! It just melts in your mouth with the delicious taste of coconut, lime, curry and umami!
Better than takeout! Hits all seven of the Thai flavor notes in a balanced symphony! This is going into regular rotation!
Love this recipe! I followed it exactly except for the lime leaves. I used lime zest. Watch the video and follow his directions and it will be a hit!
Amazing! Surprised as I only followed the basics of the recipe.
Learning why the ingredients are combined makes it easy to understand how to use them. It makes the recipe so much less intimidating.
Amazing! I couldn’t find tamarind paste or Kefir lime leaves at my local Asian store so I did without!  Was delish! I added sliced jalepenos to mine like my local Thai restaurant.
Very good 0
Really Tasty!  Eased up on the amount of curry to make it less spicy.  Arguably better than what I get at a restaurant.
Delish!! Followed every step, and it came out perfectly...kudos Chef Lee.
I love Chef Jet! And of course his beautiful wife!
I’ve been trying to cook an authentic Thai curry for awhile now...with this recipe I finally succeeded! I’ll definitely make this again. Thank you Jet!!

This dish is incredible. Tastes like a curry from a Thai restaurant! It’s also amazing as leftovers. I recommend watching the video, too—I learned a couple techniques that helped me. 

My only suggestion would be to fix the gram measurement for the Thai basil. If you’re using the metric system to measure, it became quickly clear that 95g of Thai basil was far too much. I used 20-ish.
It’s perfection. I make it every week now!
Authentic and delicious!  Everyone in the family loves it.  Been requested by in-laws several times.
The best parang curry recipe I have ever made!! It's requested often in our house!!! Thank you Chef Jet!!!

Make this now! Worth the trip to the asian market. I have thought good Penang curry was only something I could get at an authentic Thai restaurant, but this proved me wrong. Thanks Jet and the video was super helpful. I used carrots and zucchini.

I’m surprised this has so few reviews so far! Everybody loved it and it was a pretty easy recipe. I’ve never made a curry before and every time I thought I messed something up it was totally forgiving. My coconut milk shook too much on the ride home but I just added a teaspoon of coconut oil. I used a combo of chicken and tofu- both tasted great. I had to use lime zest instead of leaves because they were out at the Asian market but that seemed to work fine as well. My zucchini and pepper were also quite oversized but it was still plenty of sauce. Turned out excellent!

I live in an area with a street full of Thai and Vietnamese restaurants. This panang curry is spot on!  I used tofu instead of shrimp, lite coconut milk and didn't shred my kaffir lime leaves, just cut them in half and removed them.  I had been trying to make the perfect panang paste, turns out, Maesri has already perfected it.  It's the exact taste as my local restaurant!

I have been trying to perfect the paneang  curry recipe for months! This one came out perfect on the first try. Absolutely delicious would not change a thing . I will definitely be making this every week!!

5 stars is not enough!
This is the curry dish I have wanted to make since I’ve been cooking. The sauce was perfect In every way. I made the dish as written except added a sliced jalapeño. I will cut the zucchini differently next time; will cut it in 1/2 inch pieces then quarter to get a bit more crunch. I could not find the lime leaves so used zest as suggested in video, that worked just fine. This IS the “curry go to” !
Amazing recipe! I live how easy it is to make it too.

I made this for my family tonight. They all loved it! My son said it tasted like a great Thai restaurant dish and it would be one that would keep him going back again and again. it was so so delicious! Thank you for sharing this recipe with the world!
Bomb, authentic and delicious!
loved it
Just made this dish and it was delicious! Tastes like the panang at my favorite Thai restaurant. I thought watching the recipe video was really helpful and entertaining!
Best Thai dish I've ever made at home!  Flavors were wonderful.  Loved the consistency of the sauce. Amount of spice was perfect.  Definitely a favorite in our household.

My Thai husband said this recipe was just like what his mom used to make when he was younger. My only edit would be to not cut up the lime leaves so that it is easier to take out when serving. Love this recipe!!
Looks amazing but 6 cups of coconut milk?
Great recipe!  A very nice balance of flavor
SO DELICIOUS! Made this for me and my husband tonight and WOW, it was dynamite! The roux took a little longer to reduce than quoted, but other than that, it was easy breezy!

video.name: Panang Chicken Curry
video.description: Chef Jet Tila and his wife, Ali, team up to make her favorite Thai dish with the perfect creamy, spicy curry sauce.
